data.headline: S&P 500 ended nearly unchanged (+0.05%), Dow rose 0.1%, and Nasdaq slipped 0.2% on Friday
bullets: S&P 500 and Nasdaq posted their worst AI- and tech-led weekly losses of 2026, down about 1.4–2.1%
January CPI came in cooler than expected, driven by lower gas and used car prices, pushing Treasury yields lower
Rate-hike fears eased and Fed rate-cut bets increased, fueling a rotation out of mega-cap tech into small caps and cyclicals
Russell 2000 surged about 1.2% to 2,646, with Russell futures also up ~1.2%
Applied Materials jumped 11–13% on strong earnings, while Rivian and DraftKings were notable movers
Traders are watching for continued small-cap momentum, AI/tech sector headlines, and Fed policy signals into a holiday-shortened week
